nistRequirement: Terminate the network connection associated with a communications session at the end of the session or after [Assignment: organization-defined time period] of inactivity.

settings.displayName: M365 Idle Session Timeout for Web Apps
settings.description: Automatically signs out users from Microsoft 365 web apps after a specified period of inactivity. This setting applies to web-based apps including Outlook Web App, SharePoint Online, OneDrive, Office.com, and admin centers. The timeout prevents unauthorized access to CUI when users leave sessions unattended.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft 365 admin center (admin.microsoft.com)
2. Navigate to Settings > Org settings > Security & privacy tab
3. Select 'Idle session timeout'
4. Enable 'Turn on to set the period of inactivity for users to be signed off of Office web apps'
5. Set timeout to 3 hours (180 minutes) or less
6. Click 'Save'

Note: This setting applies only to web apps, not desktop or mobile applications.

controlMappings.mappingRationale: This setting directly enforces network session termination after inactivity for all Microsoft 365 web applications. It terminates the authentication session and forces users to reauthenticate, preventing unauthorized access to CUI through abandoned browser sessions.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Terminate the network connection associated with a communications session after organization-defined time period of inactivity

settings.description: Controls how long users can remain signed in before being required to reauthenticate when accessing Microsoft 365 resources. This prevents prolonged network sessions and ensures users must actively authenticate to maintain access to CUI.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Entra admin center (entra.microsoft.com)
2. Go to Protection > Conditional Access > Policies
3. Create new policy or edit existing
4. Under 'Assignments', select target users and cloud apps
5. Under 'Access controls > Session', select 'Sign-in frequency'
6. Set to 8 hours or less
7. Enable policy and save

Recommended: Apply to all users accessing sensitive data or configure separate policies for different risk levels.

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Sign-in frequency enforces session termination by requiring reauthentication after a defined period. This applies across all Microsoft 365 services and apps, ensuring network connections are not maintained indefinitely even if the user remains active.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Terminate the network connection associated with a communications session after organization-defined time period

settings.displayName: Conditional Access - Disable Persistent Browser Sessions
settings.description: Prevents users from remaining signed in after closing and reopening browser windows. When disabled, users must reauthenticate each time they start a new browser session, ensuring network connections terminate when browsers are closed.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Entra admin center (entra.microsoft.com)
2. Go to Protection > Conditional Access > Policies
3. Create new policy or edit existing session control policy
4. Under 'Assignments', select target users and cloud apps
5. Under 'Access controls > Session', select 'Persistent browser session'
6. Set to 'Never persistent'
7. Enable policy and save

Best practice: Apply this to all users, especially for unmanaged devices accessing CUI.

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Disabling persistent browser sessions ensures that network connections terminate when users close their browsers. This prevents session persistence across browser restarts and forces new authentication, effectively terminating the communications session.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Terminate the network connection associated with a communications session at the end of the session

settings.displayName: Conditional Access - Idle Timeout for Unmanaged Devices
settings.description: Enforces idle session timeout specifically on unmanaged devices accessing Office 365. This Conditional Access policy works in conjunction with tenant-level idle timeout settings to ensure sessions on higher-risk devices are terminated after inactivity. CIS Benchmark Level 1 recommends 3 hours or less for unmanaged devices.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. First, configure tenant-level idle session timeout (see AZ-SC-001)
2. Navigate to Microsoft Entra admin center
3. Go to Protection > Conditional Access > Policies
4. Create new policy named 'Idle Session Timeout - Unmanaged Devices'
5. Under 'Users', select 'All users'
6. Under 'Cloud apps', select 'Office 365'
7. Under 'Conditions > Client apps', select 'Browser' only
8. Under 'Conditions > Filter for devices', select 'Exclude devices marked as compliant'
9. Under 'Session', select 'Use app enforced restrictions'
10. Enable policy and save

Requires: Azure AD Premium P1 or P2 license for device-based conditional access

controlMappings.mappingRationale: This setting ensures idle session timeout applies specifically to unmanaged devices, which pose higher security risks. By targeting unmanaged devices, organizations can enforce stricter session termination policies where CUI is more vulnerable to unauthorized access through unattended sessions.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Terminate the network connection after organization-defined time period of inactivity on external/unmanaged systems

implementationNotes:
These settings work together to provide comprehensive session termination. The tenant-level idle session timeout (AZ-SC-001) provides baseline protection for all web apps, while Conditional Access policies (AZ-SC-002, AZ-SC-003, AZ-SC-004) enforce additional session controls based on authentication requirements and device trust. Organizations should implement all four settings for defense-in-depth.

CIS Microsoft 365 Foundations Benchmark v3.0.0 Section 1.3.2 (Level 1) specifically requires idle session timeout of 3 hours or less for unmanaged devices.

Microsoft Security Baseline recommends sign-in frequency of 8 hours or less for standard users and 1 hour for privileged accounts.
references: CIS Microsoft 365 Foundations Benchmark v3.0.0 - Section 1.3.2
